meanings.definition: Inclined to engage in gossip or spread rumors.
meanings.sent1: She is so gossipy, always sharing stories about others.
meanings.sent2: The gossipy neighbors were always talking about everyone on the street.
meanings.sent3: The gossipy parrot repeated all the secrets it overheard.
meanings.sent4: The gossipy wind carried tales from one end of the town to the other.
meanings.sent5: Her gossipy nature made her the center of attention at every gathering.

meanings.sent1: The atmosphere in the office was gossipy, with rumors flying around.
meanings.sent2: The gossipy magazine was filled with celebrity scandals.
meanings.sent3: The gossipy cat seemed to know all the neighborhood news.
meanings.sent4: The gossipy phone line spread news faster than anything else.
meanings.sent5: The gossipy nature of the town made it hard to keep any secret.

meanings.definition: Tending to talk about other people's private lives.
meanings.sent1: Her gossipy nature made her the go-to person for juicy details.
meanings.sent2: The gossipy group of friends always had something to say about others.
meanings.sent3: The gossipy squirrel chattered about the animals in the forest.
meanings.sent4: The gossipy river whispered secrets to the trees along its banks.
meanings.sent5: The gossipy nature of the town made it hard to keep any secret.
